file_content.text: Captain. I hope you took precautions not to be followed.
I must remind you, the very existence of our prison on Belsavis is top secret. Before you go further, you must swear to reveal nothing.
It's not like anyone listens to me anyway.
Oh, fine.
But you don't like it when I swear.
[Flirt] Do I have to?
I'm serious. Our security is already compromised by the Empire. We can't risk word getting to the underworld.
I would not reveal the Republic's secrets.
Of course.
You continue to surprise me with your loyalty.
You're the one Rogun attacked. Do you want me to do this or not?
I'm not promising anything.
They warned me about working with independents....
A few days ago, our prison here was breached. An Imperial air strike, apparently coordinated with a massive prison break within.
The planet is in chaos. Shock troops are arriving daily to contain it.
I'm just here to hunt down some old crime boss, right?
Does that affect me?
Ivory is far from "some" crime boss.
How did the Imperials find it?
I thought this was secret.
We don't know.
I don't mind smashing a few Imperials in the name of public safety.
Can I help?
Help the Republic if you can, but getting Rogun's location from Ivory must remain your first priority.
I can only authorize you to offer him certain deals--we cannot mitigate Ivory's sentence.
If he cooperates, he can have three hours a day in the exercise yards: no company, no sharp objects. A bath once a week, private except for guard droids.
If his information leads to Rogun the Butcher's arrest, he gets a single monitored holocall of his choosing.
Um... that's not such a great deal....
That's it?
It was a fight even to get that.
You know, a man gets lonely all locked up, all alone....
[Flirt] That's no fun.
You feeling his pain, Captain? What's the matter, that little harem you travel with doesn't keep your ship warm?
Don't joke with Ivory. He's smart. His followers were so loyal the Senate passed new legislation allowing them to be convicted as a single individual.
My father used to say Ivory was as much cult leader as criminal.
So, they're all in there with him? Is that a good thing?
Use caution.
I have heard him spoken of as a worthy opponent.
Is, ah, that law still in effect? Just checking.
Not the kind of guy you bring home to mom. What else do I need to know?
I get the point.
I wasn't planning on offering gifts.
I do this my way.
Rogun the Butcher was Ivory's protege. If Ivory doesn't give him up, you have permission to be... coercive.
I've made arrangements with Marshall Cavarat at the Republic base. She'll be able to help you with anything you need.
